de.kerner.commons.exec
Class AbstractProgrammRunner

java.lang.Object
  de.kerner.commons.exec.AbstractProgrammRunner
All Implemented Interfaces:
ProcessRunner
public abstract class AbstractProgrammRunner
extends java.lang.Object
implements ProcessRunner

An implementation of AbstractProgrammRunner will create and execute operating system processes. It will also help to take care of preconditions and postconditions of execution. Therefore calling createAndRun() or createAndRun(OutputStream, OutputStream) will perform as follows:

  • prepare() is called to take care of any preconditions.
  • possibility to shortcut execution is checked. That means if all files, that have been previously defined by addShortCutFile(File) are accessible, operating system process is not executed and an exit value of 0 is returned.
  • if no shortcut is possible, execution of process is triggered. If any files have been defined by redirectOutStreamToFile(File) or redirectErrStreamToFile(File), stdout respective stderr are written to coresponding files.
  • if exit code was 0, finsishSuccess() is called; otherwise finishError().

Example: TODO

Author:
Alexander Kerner

AbstractProcessRunner

Constructor Detail

AbstractProgrammRunner

public AbstractProgrammRunner(java.io.File workingDir)

Constructs a new AbstractProgrammRunnner. Process working directory is set to workingDir. workingDir may be null -- this means to use the working directory of the current Java process, usually the directory named by the system property user.dir, as the working directory of the child process.

Parameters:
workingDir -

                    throws java.lang.Exception

This method is called after successful termination of operating system process (exit code == 0).

finishError

public void finishError()
                 throws java.lang.Exception

This method is called after unsuccessful termination of operating system process (exit code != 0).

By default, this method does nothing.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

setWaitDelay

public void setWaitDelay(long millisecs)

If any files have been defined via addResultFileToWaitFor(File), current thread will check accessibility for these files every millisecs milliseconds. If one of these files are not accessible jet for any reason (file system issues, remote execution etc.) current thread will wait millisecs milliseconds and then do check again.

Attention: if one of these files will never be accessible thread will wait forever!

Parameters:
millisecs - milliseconds to wait before next accessibility check

getWaitDelay

public long getWaitDelay()

Returns current waiting delay in milliseconds.

Returns:
current waiting delay
See Also:
addResultFileToWaitFor(File), setWaitDelay(long)

addShortCutFile

public void addShortCutFile(java.io.File file)

Defines a file for shortcutting execution. That means if all files, that have been defined via this method are accessible before actually executing operating system process, this process will not be executed but createAndRun() or createAndRun(OutputStream, OutputStream) will return 0.

Parameters:
file - Shortcut file
